Events Monthly Events Art Gallery Opening Reception Pride Skate Nights Art Walk Wilton Manors Artists Showcase Annual Events Stonewall Pride Parade & Festival Black History Month Events The Cookout: Black History Month Pride On The Drive Women‚Äôs History Month HOTtopics: Town Hall Series (Quarterly) July 4th Fireworks Cruise PrideF√™te: An LGBTQ Caribbean Festival The South Florida Men‚Äôs Wellness Conference Taste of the Island Art HOTspots Art About HOTspots Art Art Walk Wilton Manors Sculpture Walk Art Gallery with Dennis Dean Classifieds About Join Us Contact Us Advertise Hotspots Magazine Home Features The Florida Renaissance Festival Brings Patrons Back in Time Again Features The Florida Renaissance Festival Brings Patrons Back in Time Again By Hotspots Magazine - February 23, 2025 464 Facebook Twitter Pinterest WhatsApp Advertisement All kings, queens, court ladies, knights, squires, jesters, and villagers are invited to the 33 rd annual Florida Renaissance Festival with six more weekends running through Mar. 23 at Quiet Waters Park in Deerfield Beach. Enter the gates of the kingdom as an elegant courtier, rebellious outlaw, or valiant knight, and dress the part with period attire such as tunics, broad-brimmed hats, puffy-sleeved shirts, lacy gowns, petticoats, cloaks, or aprons. Costumes are not required‚Äîbut thousands wear historical clothing each year to immerse themselves into the true spirit of the Renaissance period where imaginations run wild and there‚Äôs fun for the entire family. The Florida Renaissance Festival is produced by nationally acclaimed Bobby Rodriguez Productions , a creator of entertaining and cultural experiences for adults and children alike. ‚ÄúFor more than 30 years this festival¬†has been¬†a very¬†unique¬†event,‚Äù said Rodriguez. ‚ÄúIt is one of the most anticipated happenings in South Florida, and each year it gets better with¬†new and different activities and entertainment.‚Äù¬†Guests can explore artisan markets, savor delicious foods, and immerse themselves in a world of merriment, shock, and surprise in any of the eight themed memorable weekends. What‚Äôs Old is New in 2025‚Ä¶ Loud Mime Show ‚Äì It‚Äôs an oxymoron, but this 2023 winner of the Carny Carnage Award at the Sideshow Hootenanny is a tongue in cheek comedy featuring superb juggling, death defying stunts, and a performer that grandma warned you about! The Hurdy Gurdy Guy ‚Äì Dating back nearly a thousand years, Hurdy Gurdy is a form of entertainment not much seen in the U.S., until now. The star, Harry, plays music from the 12 th century to the present in a style learned from teachers in France and England. The headliner presents a unique sound you won‚Äôt want to miss, and he will answer questions to educate the audience about his unique instrument. Clan Tynker Circus ‚Äì A troupe of brothers and sisters perform a stunning array of acts in this award-winning Vaudeville-style circus. Set to a live musical landscape, audiences will enjoy an amazing menagerie of entertainment that includes magic tricks, stilt walking, juggling skills, unicycling, sword swallowing, fire eating and more! The show also features an array of dangerous stunts, and a spectacular fire finale you won‚Äôt want to miss. Ga√™lica ‚Äì An international Celtic folk and world music trio, formed by Daniela Padr√≥n (fiddle and vocals), also features Gabriel Figueira (bagpipes, woodwinds, percussion, vocals), and Rub√©n Guti√©rrez (guitars, percussion, vocals). These entertainers have released five studio albums, were nominated for a Latin Grammy Award, and won five Pepsi Music Awards, including Best Folk Album. They have performed in the U.S., Europe, and Latin America captivating audiences with original compositions and traditional tunes. Krewes Korner ‚Äì Raise the Jolly Roger, cannonball coming! This buccaneer is a professional Pirate impersonator with more than 15 years of experience. Feel as if you‚Äôre aboard a fantastic pirate ship in the high seas as this pirate brings history to life before your eyes. Edged Feather Experiences ‚Äì Features Crystal ‚ÄúCryss‚Äù Stacey a master class falconer and wildlife educator who has been training birds of prey for more than a decade, presenting more than 1,000 educational programs in nine states. Her birds are trained to fly totally untethered and prepared to show their unique natural behaviors and vastly different personalities! Piper Jones Band ‚Äì This lyrical, high-energy duo base their music on the beautiful sounds of Highland bagpipes, accompanied by the unique percussion chords of the bouzouki. While featuring traditional tunes from Ireland, Scotland, and the inter-Celtic world, the duo features songs and audience interaction as they perform instrumental compositions and historical dance music in a unique and authentic style. The Flaming Ginger, Jon Norton ‚Äì This fast-paced, family-friendly fire danger comedy show will thrill the audience and keep you on the edge of your seats! Be amazed as Norton juggles fire while riding seven-foot unicycles and quips non-stop jokes along the way. The Byrne Brothers ‚Äì From Donegal, Ireland these brothers are a multi award-winning family band taking the Irish American scene by storm! The band consists of Luca on accordion, Finn on banjo, mandolin, and guitar, Dempsey on bodhran and whistle, and their father Tommy on uilleann pipes, fiddle, guitar, and grade 1 bagpiper. Enjoy their electrifying and high-energy performance that showcases modern traditional Irish music and world-class Irish dancing. There will also be a new activity called the Gear Garden Gem Mining Co . where guests can find rare and breathtaking gems in our one-of-a-kind gem mining area. Guests will purchase a 5 or 10-pound bag and have an opportunity to pan for hidden treasures they get to bring home. A special key will help identify the gems and more details about each one. *For those that have frequented the Festival in the past, the Biergarten is now known as The Gear Garden featuring an all-new pub, stage, soda booth, and the Gear Garden Gem Mining Co . Florida Renaissance Festival 2025 Themed Weekends Weekend Four: Feb. 22-23 ‚Äì Peg Legs and Polly‚Äôs ‚Äì Part of the Ship, Part of the Crew Weekend Five: March 1-2 ‚Äì Marketplace Mayhem ‚Äì Shopeth ‚Äòtill you Dropeth! Weekend Six: March 8-9 ‚Äì Gears and Gadgets ‚Äì The Lost Inventions of DaVinci Weekend Seven: March 15-16 ‚Äì Gaelic Legends: Tales of the Blarney Stone Weekend Eight: March 22-23 ‚Äì Enchanted Extravaganza: Characters on the Loose Admission to the festival is $37 for adults, and $15 for children (kids under 5 years old are free). Kids 11 and under get in free of charge for the first weekend only but still must pay the county park fee of $1.50. Purchase a 2025 Season Pass Perk online and save 50% off a single day admission ticket. Season pass perks include a special commemorative pin in celebration of the 33 rd annual festival, $12 VIP parking, express lane for entrance and express lanes at all major pubs, VIP seating for at the joust arena, access to an exclusive VIP rest area, special gifts and discount food coupons that can be picked up at the box office ‚Äì plus much more! VIP parking will be available for purchase Online and In-Person. Guests MUST show their Season Pass purchase. Separately, we offer a $3 active military and senior discount, they cannot be combined. For tickets and more information visit: www.ren-fest.com . Tickets On Sale Now! Weekends, October 11th through November 30th and Thanksgiving Friday Huzzah and welcome to the Texas Renaissance Festival, a grand spectacle that transports visitors to an era of chivalry, merriment, and enchantment. Nestled in the heart of Texas, we are the largest and most acclaimed Renaissance-themed attraction in the United States. Whether one is donned in period garb or simply a curious spectator in one's favorite tee shirt and jeans, the Texas Renaissance Festival promises an unforgettable journey into the magic and splendor of the Renaissance era. 2025 Dates: Weekends, October 11th through November 30th and Thanksgiving Friday Oct 11-12 Oct 18-19 Oct 25-26 Nov 1-2 Nov 8-9 Nov 15-16 Nov 22-23 Nov 28-30 Oktoberfest 1001 Dreams All Hallows Eve Pirate Adventure Heroes and Villains Barbarian Invasion Highland Fling Celtic Christmas Prev Next Themed Weekends Oktoberfest Journey back in time to old Bavaria as the King and Queen open the Festival season with a celebration of the best of the wurst (and the bier )! Show off your lederhosen in our daily costume contest or participate in our bratwurst eating contest! October 11 (Saturday) and 12 (Sunday) 1001 Dreams Faeries, elves and other fanciful creatures bring enchantment to the lanes of New Market Village. Show off your magical finery in the fantasy costume contest or test your endurance in the fiery dragon-wing eating contest. October 18 (Saturday) and 19 (Sunday) All Hallows Eve Ghoulies and ghosties arrive for some scary good when the Kingdom welcomes the Transylvanian court. Enter our Halloween costume contest or the Kettle Korn eating contest for a chance to win some "spook-tacular" prizes. October 25 (Saturday) and 26 (Sunday) Pirate Adventure Avast, Ye Hearties! Heave to and come ashore for the most piratical party on the seven seas. Show off your best buccaneer frock in the Best Dressed Pirate contest and try your luck at the Fish-N-Chips eating contest. November 1 (Saturday) and November 2 (Sunday) Heroes and Villains The mightiest heroes and heroines clash with the darkest of villains and vixens from history and legend. Show off your alter ego in the Heroes and Villains costume contest. If your superpower is eating, accept the challenge of winning the gyro eating contest. November 8 (Saturday) and 9 (Sunday) Barbarian Invasion Join the Great Horde and feast, drink, and plunder your way through the village during this barbaric rumpus.  Are you the worst dressed barbarian around? Prove it by joining our costume contest! November 15 (Saturday) and 16 (Sunday) Highland Fling Lads and lassies- the pipes are calling you to a celebration of the joys of Scotland. Witness the thrill of the Highland games, show of your Scotish finery in the Bonnie Knees contest, and see if you have the misneach (courage) to participate in the haggis eating contest. November 22 (Saturday) and 23 (Sunday) Celtic Christmas Father Christmas, Mother Christmas, and all the Christmas elves welcome children of all ages to our final three-day celebration of the coming Yule-tide season. The Kingdom is transformed into a Christmas wonderland and holiday music fills the lanes. Find the perfect gifts for everyone on your list in our over 400 shoppes.¬†There's also a holiday costume contest and the pumpkin pie eating contest to add to your Christmas cheer. Father Christmas will be available for kids of all ages during the final three-day weekend. He will be up front near the festival entrance on Friday, Saturday and Sunday on Celtic Christmas weekend throughout the day. Visitors can choose to sit on Father Christmas' lap, or near him. Whichever makes you more comfortable. November 28 (Friday), 29 (Saturday), and 30 (Sunday) 70 Acres of Land 200+ Acres of Camping Facilities 500,000+ Guests Annually 1974 Since 21 Stages 400+ On-Site Shops Nation's Largest Entertainment Families Friends Groups Weddings Entertainment Enchanting Entertainment Thrill to the charge of knights jousting on their mighty steeds. Fall under the spell of magic and merriment. Laugh and be amazed at the clowns, jugglers, acrobats, and magicians performing on stages throughout the village. Watch with excitement as birds of prey soar through the air. Stay to dark and delight in the fire show and Royal Fireworks every festival evening! The Texas Renaissance Festival is proud to host world renowned performers on the many stages located throughout the festival. - Fun for Kids & Families The Texas Renaissance Festival is a magical place for family fun and entertainment. Try your skills at the archery, axe throwing or Jacob's ladder. Take a ride on the swings in the Enchanted Forest or take a spin on the DaVinci Flying Machines. After you've taken in the Fire Whip Show or the Great Rondini, get yourself a turkey leg and a lemonade while you walk around and browse the shoppes. Lots of neat shops, awesome performances, and good food/drinks. I've been to a few renaissance festivals and I would say this was one of my favorites for sure. -Nathan Wiles Friends I love coming to the faire with friends, and making new friends. TRF is my second home and my faire family is amazing! -Chip Ware, Houston Groups Experience an exciting group outing like no other. Groups will enjoy strolling the cobblestone paths of our authentic 55-acre 16th century village, visiting more than 400 shoppes featuring unique arts and crafts, foods from many cultures, games of skill, and a variety of human-powered rides. In addition, hundreds of costumed characters are there to entertain your party with over 200 performances daily. Each of our eight themed weekends brings a new adventure for your group, offering unique programs, activities, and more! This was the first event in nearly six years where I did not have to raise one finger to help. From the time we walked into the area Maw and Pa greeted us with the delicious food and hospitality. Out of the blue, the cast of characters from Alice in Wonderland and Peter Pan descended into our area to liven our group up which we felt was over the top and much appreciated by everyone. -Toby Lee, HARC Fairy Tale Weddings The King and Queen invite you to have your fairy tale wedding at the Texas Renaissance Festival . Create the royal wedding of your dreams in 16th century-style within the walls of our charming English Village. Get swept away with one of our exclusive wedding packages designed to enhance the romance and magic of your wedding day! The atmosphere was most enjoyable, when everything is put together I can't think of another service that out does the Texas renaissance festival weddings. It was a perfect day. -Marcus Moreno Newsletter Signup Want to be notified when an article is published? Enter your email address to be the first to know. The Florida Renaissance Festival is an event the whole family can enjoy‚Äîfeaturing live performances, reenactments, jousting, games, an artisan village, and more!

Held annually since 1991, the festival typically runs between the months of February and March and is open on weekends, from 10 a.m. to sunset, in Quiet Waters Park in Deerfield Beach, FL.

Tickets can be pre-ordered or purchased at the gate.  All major credit cards accepted, and ATMs are available on site.

The Florida Renaissance Festival is produced by the nationally award-winning Bobby Rodriguez Productions, operating in South Florida since 1981.  For more information, visit www.ren-fest.com. We are incredibly proud to share that our Administrative Director, Christina, has been honored with the prestigious 2025 Emerging Leader Award from Greater Miami Festivals and Events Association ! üèÜ

The Florida Renaissance Festival is an event the whole family can enjoy‚Äîfeaturing live performances, reenactments, jousting, games, an artisan village, and more!

Held annually since 1991, the festival typically runs between the months of February and March and is open on weekends, from 10 a.m. to sunset, in Quiet Waters Park in Deerfield Beach, FL.

Tickets can be pre-ordered or purchased at the gate.  All major credit cards accepted, and ATMs are available on site.

The Florida Renaissance Festival is produced by the nationally award-winning Bobby Rodriguez Productions, operating in South Florida since 1981.  For more information, visit www.ren-fest.com. Days Hrs Min Sec Sign Up For Our Newsletter Skip to main content Skip to footer Texas Renaissance Festival 21778 Farm to Market 1774 Todd Mission, Texas 77363 Varied The Kingdom Directions, Parking, & Maps Themed Weekends Lockers Accessibility FAQ Lost and Found Newsletter Sign-Up Contact TRF Things To Do & Entertainment Entertainment Schedule Performers For Lords & Ladies (21+) For Families Guided Tours Survival Guide for Newbies Speak like a TRF Pro Where to Stay Camping at TRF Campground Map Campground Rules & FAQs Camping Passes Guilds Lodging Weddings & Events Weddings @ TRF Parties & Events Contact Weddings & Events Shops, Food, & Drinks Dragonslayer Gift Shop Shoppes Food & Drink Get Involved Become A Sponsor Cast Auditions For our Cast For our Vendors TRF Careers Media Media Pass Request Press Kit & Releases Podcast Tickets General Ticket Info Parking Passes Group Tickets Info Stay & Play Ticket Info Season Tickets Info Campground Ticket Info Liability Waiver Yes, We Donate Introducing the Tex Ren Fest Wedding Team August 29, 2019 #Weddings Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Planning 60-70 weddings during a festival season (19 days) can be a very stressful job. The hours put in are way beyond the average 40 hour work week. As the Texas Renaissance Wedding Coordinator, I am fortunate to have a wonderful staff that helps make dreams into a reality. I'd like to introduce the team that I have the pleasure of working with, because I couldn't make these weddings come true for our couples without them. Valyssa Brauner : I have been on the Renaissance wedding team for seven years. I am a Sam Houston State University student studying Family and Consumer Sciences. My goal is to pursue a career as an event planner. I am currently working in the Texas Ren Fest office helping to plan all of the weddings and group events. I will be taking time off from the festival this season to enjoy my senior year in college. My hobbies include being out on the lake, adventuring to new places, camping and watching movies/TV. I'm the proud daughter of a brave police officer and a beautiful, smart event planner. Susan Maddox has served on our Texas Renaissance wedding staff for two seasons. She works full-time as a literacy specialist in Klein ISD and as an adjunct professor of English at Tomball college. For Susan, personal fitness is essential. She teaches water aerobics, Zumba and Body Pump. She absolutely loves planning special ceremonies and taking part in weddings to make every person feel loved at the Texas Renaissance Festival. New to the TRF Wedding Team but not new to the Faire are: Valea Brauner : I have been an actress on the German Court for four years, but decided to take a break from acting this season. Instead, I will be helping the wedding team this season as much as my schedule will allow. I will be a sophomore next year at Magnolia High School, and my dream is to one day be a sign language interpreter. I am on the varsity swim team and in choir. I enjoy going to our lake house, hanging out with friends and family, and pretty much everything with water. Oh, did I mention I love to sleep? Andrew Wilson : This will mark my 7th year at TRF.  I have been on the Royal Guard all six years. I worked my way up to core company and then group leader. I've lost track of how many weddings I've been in! Hobbies include anything costume related, fairs, and cosplay. I am an avid outdoor enthusiast enjoying hiking, kayaking and camping. We are all passionate and enjoy what we do. We want to make sure the day is exactly what the couple has envisioned. During those stressful times, you may catch us acting silly and having fun! The special events team has some exciting plans for 2020 that we can't wait to share with you in the near future! Kim Murphy jkimmurphy Latest Tyler Perry Accuser Derek Dixon Details Sexual Assault Allegations in TV Interview: ‚ÄòI Thought It Would Stop ‚Ä¶ and It Didn‚Äôt‚Äô 1 day ago Brooklyn Horror Film Festival Unveils 2025 Lineup: Zombie Drag Queens, Two World Premieres and an Ernest Dickerson Tribute 2 days ago Michael Caine Coming Out of Retirement at 92 Years Old for Vin Diesel‚Äôs ‚ÄòLast Witch Hunter 2‚Äô at Lionsgate 3 days ago See All HBO George Coulam , the founder and longstanding owner of the Texas Renaissance Festival whose eclectic lifestyle and hunt for a successor were documented in the 2024 HBO docuseries ‚Äú Ren Faire ,‚Äù was found dead in his home in Todd Mission, Texas on Wednesday morning. He was 87. An investigation remains ongoing and a cause of death is not known at this time. The Todd Mission Police Department was dispatched to Coulam‚Äôs residence, adjacent to the Renaissance Festival‚Äôs premises, on Wednesday morning. The Grimes County Sheriff‚Äôs Office and Texas Rangers were present for assistance. Coulam was pronounced dead by authorities upon arrival. Related Stories How Angelina Jolie‚Äôs Health Journey Inspired Alice Winocour‚Äôs Paris Ensemble ‚ÄòCouture': ‚ÄòIt Was Quite Healing in Many Ways‚Äô Kaitlyn Dever, Meghann Fahy and Issa Rae Among Through Her Lens Jurors ‚ÄúTo our Texas Renaissance family and friends, we are deeply saddened by the loss of George Coulam, founder of the Texas Renaissance Festival,‚Äù the Texas Renaissance Festival wrote in a statement on social media. ‚ÄúFor more than 50 years, he built a community that has become a cherished tradition for generations of performers, staff and guests. At this time, we ask for respect and privacy for Mr. Coulam‚Äôs family and the extended Texas Renaissance Festival family as they grieve.‚Äù Popular on Variety Coulam‚Äôs death comes less than two weeks after a Grimes County District court ordered the Texas Renaissance Festival must be sold, ending a nearly two-year civil case. In the decision, Judge Gary W. Chaney of the 506th state District Court, also ordered that Coulam must pay over $23 million in damages to cover attorney‚Äôs fees and money lost by the fest‚Äôs buyer. The suit alleged that a group of RW Lands Inc., says Texas Stargate, Inc., Royal Campground, Inc., and Texas RF, Inc. agreed to purchase the Festival, property and assets from Coulam for $60 million. The plaintiff claimed that Coulam and his associates did not provide required documents for the sale and that the original owners failed to close the transaction by its agreed-upon date. Coulam denied the allegations. Coulam founded the Texas Renaissance Festival in 1974 and has overseen its growth into the largest such gathering in the United States. Along with the court order to sell, Coulam also lost office as the mayor of the fest‚Äôs premises, Todd Mission, in early May. He had been the only mayor of the town since its 1982 incorporation until losing re-election this year, with city council member Stephen Mensing sworn in. The operations of the Texas Renaissance Festival, infamous among locals, were documented in the 2024 HBO docuseries ‚ÄúRen Faire,‚Äù which followed Coulam‚Äôs less-than-motivated search for a successor to lead the festival, and the surrounding business affiliates vying to take over operations. The three-episode run also included details of Coulam‚Äôs dedicated online dating pursuits and his unforgiving temperament around his staff. The series‚Äô events concluded prior to the emergence of the recent civil lawsuit against Coulam that reached an end in early May. ‚ÄúFunctionally, he actually is a king. He‚Äôs created a real-life fiefdom,‚Äù series director and executive producer Lance Oppenheim told Variety in an interview before the series premiered. ‚ÄúThe first thing he said to me was ‚ÄòI used to play the king, but now I‚Äôm a horny old man. I want to find someone that can take care of the festival.‚Äô These were the things just flowing out of him. He was maybe looking for an outlet ‚Äî somebody that he has no control over. He doesn‚Äôt have any friends that he doesn‚Äôt employ.‚Äù Coulam faced other legal troubles in recent years, including allegations of sexual harassment and wrongful termination. The festival settled a 2021 lawsuit filed by a former employee, who claimed that Coulam made her sift through ‚Äúsugar daddy‚Äù websites to facilitate his romantic life. His death is under investigation. The Brief Texas Renaissance Festival founder George "King George" Coulam has died at his home in Todd Mission, officials confirm. His cause of death is not known at this time. Coulam was the founder and longtime owner of the festival. He previously served as mayor of Todd Mission for more than 40 years. TODD MISSION, Texas - Texas Renaissance Festival founder George "King George" Coulam has died, authorities confirm. Death investigation at King George‚Äôs home What we know: According to the Todd Mission city manager, police were called to Coulam's home at about 9 a.m. on Wednesday. He was found deceased in his home. The cause of Coulam's death is under investigation by the Texas Rangers, Todd Mission Police, and the Grimes County Sheriff's Office. Officials say there is no suspected danger to the public. What we don't know: Coulam's cause of death is not known at this time. Who is King George? Dig deeper: Coulam is the founder and longtime owner of the Texas Renaissance Festival. He started the Texas Renaissance Festival in 1974, and it has grown into the largest of its kind in the United States. In addition to being the festival's leader, Coulam served as mayor of Todd Mission for more than four decades, but lost the most recent election on May 3. In 2024, the HBO docuseries "Ren Faire" focused on the festival's succession and Coulam‚Äôs eventual retirement, highlighting the tension between his desire to find a romantic partner and his need to choose a successor. It also highlighted Coulam‚Äôs strict leadership style. There have been ongoing legal disputes and potential sales of the festival, with a recent judge's order in early May mandating the sale of Coulam‚Äôs properties, including the festival. ‚ÄòHe built a community‚Äô Texas Renaissance Festival founder ‚ÄòKing George‚Äô found dead in his home According to the Todd Mission city manager, George "King George" Coulam was pronounced dead in his home on Wednesday. FOX 26's Leslie DelasBour spoke to community members who knew him well. What they're saying: Niki Marshall is a former member of the performance company with the Texas Renaissance Festival. She says not all of her memories of George's leadership are positive, but the TRF community will keep the festival going. "The only thing that I could say for him is that he did hire some pretty cool people to be in that space," said Marshall. "He gave us the direction that we needed, and I got the opportunity to really make a difference. And it wasn‚Äôt just for me, it was for the patrons that we performed for every day." Organizers of the Texas Renaissance Festival sent the following statement to FOX 26: "We are deeply saddened by the loss of George Coulam, founder of the Texas Renaissance Festival. For more than 50 years, he built a community that has become a cherished tradition for generations of performers, staff, and guests. At this time, we ask for respect and privacy for Mr. Coulam‚Äôs family and the extended Texas Renaissance Festival family as they grieve. As this is a deeply personal matter, we are not offering additional comments at this time." Todd Mission City Manager Neal Wendele made the following statement: "Mr. Coulam, a visionary leader, founded the Texas Renaissance Festival in 1974, transforming a remote area into a cultural destination. His visionary leadership led to the incorporation of Todd Mission in 1982, where he served as the first and only mayor until May 8, 2025, shaping our community‚Äôs unique identity. The City of Todd Mission offers its deepest condolences to Mr. Coulam‚Äôs family and friends. We request privacy for those affected and will provide updates as appropriate." The Source: The information in this article was gathered from sources, the Grimes County Sheriff's Office, and the Texas Renaissance Festival. Background information: The Renaissance Pleasure Faire (RPF) has a variety of opportunities for people with a wide range of performance experience and skills.
